theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem integral_limit_interchange_of_uniform_convergence
    -- Let {F_n} be a sequence of functions and F be a function, both from â„ to â„.
    {F_n : â„• â†’ â„ â†’ â„} {F : â„ â†’ â„}
    -- Let [a, b] be a closed interval in â„.
    {a b : â„}
    -- Assume F_n converges uniformly to F on S = [a,b]. `[a,b]` implies `a â‰¤ b`.
    (h_le : a â‰¤ b)
    (h_uniform_conv : TendstoUniformlyOn F_n F atTop (Set.Icc a b))
    -- Assume that F and all F_n are integrable on [a,b]. The standard Lebesgue measure on â„ is inferred.
    (h_F_integrable : MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn F (Set.Icc a b))
    (h_Fn_integrable : âˆ€ n, MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (F_n n) (Set.Icc a b)) :
    -- Then the limit of the integrals of F_n is the integral of F.
    Tendsto (fun n â†¦ intervalIntegral (F_n n) a b) atTop (ğ“ (intervalIntegral F a b)) := by
```

import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem integral_limit_interchange_of_uniform_convergence
    -- Let {F_n} be a sequence of functions and F be a function, both from â„ to â„.
    {F_n : â„• â†’ â„ â†’ â„} {F : â„ â†’ â„}
    -- Let [a, b] be a closed interval in â„.
    {a b : â„}
    -- Assume F_n converges uniformly to F on S = [a,b]. `[a,b]` implies `a â‰¤ b`.
    (h_le : a â‰¤ b)
    (h_uniform_conv : TendstoUniformlyOn F_n F atTop (Set.Icc a b))
    -- Assume that F and all F_n are integrable on [a,b]. The standard Lebesgue measure on â„ is inferred.
    (h_F_integrable : MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn F (Set.Icc a b))
    (h_Fn_integrable : âˆ€ n, MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (F_n n) (Set.Icc a b)) :
    -- Then the limit of the integrals of F_n is the integral of F.
    Tendsto (fun n â†¦ intervalIntegral (F_n n) a b) atTop (ğ“ (intervalIntegral F a b)) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ The functions $F$ and $F_n$ for all $n$ are integrable on the interval $[a,b]$ [tc_2].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For each $n$, $\left|\int_a^b F_n(x)\,dx - \int_a^b F(x)\,dx\right| \le \int_a^b |F_n(x) - F(x)|\,dx$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
have l1 : âˆ€ n, |(âˆ« x in a..b, F_n n x) - âˆ« x in a..b, F x| â‰¤ âˆ« x in a..b, |F_n n x - F x| := by
  intro n
  apply norm_intervalIntegral_sub_le_integral_norm_sub
  Â· rwa [intervalIntegrable_iff, Set.uIcc_of_le h_le]
  Â· rwa [intervalIntegrable_iff, Set.uIcc_of_le h_le]
  Â· exact h_le

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ The sequence of functions $\{F_n\}$ converges uniformly to a function $F$ on the interval $S=[a,b]$ [tc_1].
â€¢ The functions $F$ and $F_n$ for all $n$ are integrable on the interval $[a,b]$ [tc_2].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For each $n$, $\int_a^b |F_n(x) - F(x)|\,dx \le (b-a) \|F_n - F\|_S$, where $\|g\|_S = \sup_{x \in S} |g(x)|$ is the supremum norm [l2].

â€¢ For each $n$, $\int_a^b |F_n(x) - F(x)|\,dx \le (b-a) \|F_n - F\|_S$ [l2].
â€¢ $\lim_{n\to\infty} \|F_n - F\|_S = 0$ [l3].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ $\int_a^b F(x)\,dx=\lim_{n\to\infty}\int_a^b F_n(x)\,dx$ [ts_1].
